title: modulecmd fails to load already loaded modules
body:
I have the following situation:

On the HPC cluster I use the intel compiler is provided by a module (intel/16.0). So I have the following in my compilers.yaml:
```
modules:
- intel/16.0
```

```
SyntaxError: invalid syntax
```

Obviously, the the intel/16.0 module is loaded several times but never unloaded. Further, I saw that the issue arises in https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/lib/spack/spack/util/module_cmd.py#137. In case, the module is already loaded, it writes a message to stderr and nothing to stdout. Therefore, in line 138 the if is true.

I wonder what the best solution is. I added the following:
```
loaded = modulecmd('list', output=str, error=str)
if mod in loaded:
  return
```

By this, I check if the module is already loaded. However, I do not know if this is a good solution. Would it be better to unload the module at some position? I do not know where the origin is. The issue does not appear for every package. E.g., ```spack spec boost``` works without any issues.
